poollogic.title: Stephen: Re-Entering Appalachia Project (RAP)
poollogic.description: Survey tool for Dr. Carrie Oser's RAP Project
poollogic.introduction: This is the introduction for Stephen's test pool
poollogic.afterward: Thank you for taking our pool.

sheetlogic.title: Section II: Alter Characteristics and Functions
sheetlogic.description: These questions will be asked about each person named in Section I

eddilogic.title: StudyIntroductionBoilerPlate
eddilogic.prompt: Re-entering Appalachia Project (RAP)
eddilogic.content:
READ:

Hello, my name is____, and I work for the Re-entering Appalachia Project (also known as RAP). Thank you for agreeing to talk with me today. This interview usually takes about 1 to 2 hours to complete. I'm going to read you a set of questions exactly as they are worded so that each person is asked the same thing. I will need to keep things moving along, so I hope that I don't sound rude if I tell you we need to move on to the next question.

I will be asking primarily about your personal and family background, religious and spiritual beliefs, re-entry needs, drug use, access to drug treatment, health, criminal and legal involvement, and the people in your life. All of your answers will be kept confidential and will in no way affect your legal status, or any services or money you may receive. Many of my questions will refer to the last 3 months, which is referring to the time since your release from prison, or the last 30 days. I'll try to be clear, but please ask me if you are not sure about the time period involved.

It is very important that you be open and honest. Some questions may be sensitive or difficult to talk about, but they are necessary to help us understand the re-entry process in Appalachia. Do you have any questions before we start?

eddilogic._comment: Is there any way to dynamically display the current date? Maybe through PHP?

introboil2
eddilogic.prompt: <em>READ<em>
eddilogic.content: It is important that you think about the last 3 months and the last 30 days. I will keep referring back to these time frames throughout our interview.

eddilogic.title: DemoBoil
eddilogic.prompt: <em>READ<em>
eddilogic.content: Next, I would like to ask your some questions about your background. Please remember your answers will be kept private.

eddilogic.title: Spiritual Well-Being Scale
eddilogic.prompt: Spiritual Well-Being Scale
eddilogic.content: For each of the following statements, please indicate the extent of your agreement or disagreement as it describes your personal spiritual experience. When I refer to a "higher power," please understand that that could mean different things to different people, for example: a Christian God, forms of nature, energy...or other things that people may choose to believe in. When answering these questions, please refer to your own personal belief systems.

eddilogic.title: relgood
eddilogic.prompt: <label>I don't find much satisfaction in private prayer.  (Choose one)</label>

eddilogic.title: ReentryBoil
eddilogic.prompt: Re-Entry Needs 1
eddilogic.content: When you were released from prison, which of the following areas did you need help with? Please indicate whether you needed help in this area, whether or not you received help, and where you received help from.

eddilogic.title: PNathin

arrayPrompts.prompt: Probation/parole office (but someone other than a Social Service Clinician, SSC)
Outreach, health education, or prevention program

eddilogic.title: VivitrolBoilerplate
eddilogic.prompt: Next, we would like to specifically discuss one type of medication for the treatment of opioid dependence called Vivitrol® (also known as extended release naltrexone). It is administered through a monthly injection. As part of the Kentucky’s response to the opioid epidemic, Senate Bill 192 was passed in 2015 to give funds for the DOC to offer Vivitrol® to eligible inmates prior to release from prison.

eddilogic.title: vveduc
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Did you receive any educational materials on Vivitrol ® while you were incarcerated?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvtalk
eddilogic.prompt: (Read list and check all that apply)

eddilogic.title: vvask
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Were you able to ask prison staff questions about Vivitrol?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvstffsp
eddilogic.prompt: <label>How much do you agree with this statement: Prison <u>substance abuse treatment staff</u> are supportive of the use of Vivitrol?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvmedsp
eddilogic.prompt: <label>How much do you agree with this statement: Prison <u>medical staff</u> are supportive of the use of Vivitrol?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvinmtsp
eddilogic.prompt: <label>How much do you agree with this statement:<u>Other inmates</u> who are supportive of the use of Vivitrol?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvinmtnk
eddilogic.prompt: (Probes: Describe what they like and don’t like about Vivitrol? Describe what concerns they have about taking Vivitrol while in prison? While in the community?)

eddilogic.title: vvinjinc
eddilogic.prompt: <label> Did you receive a Vivitrol injection while incarcerated?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvinjwhy
eddilogic.prompt: <label>If no, why did you not get a Vivitrol injection while incarcerated? (open ended)</label>

eddilogic.title: vvinjy
eddilogic.prompt: (read list and check all that apply, then skip to question #40)

arrayPrompts.prompt: didn’t want to do the drug screening while in prison
didn’t want to do the medical evaluation while in prison
not eligible after the medical evaluation
Vivitrol has too many side effects
did not want to be on a medication (desire for abstinence)
fear of being treated rudely or unkindly
family/personal issues (e.g., spouse didn’t want me to be on Vivitrol)
preferred to use another type of medication assisted treatment after release such as methadone or buprenorphine (also known as Suboxone and Zubsolv)

eddilogic.title: vvinjcon
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Did you want to continue Vivitrol after release?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvinj3mo
eddilogic.prompt: <label>In the past 3 months, have you gone to a doctor for an injection of Vivitrol?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvinjy
eddilogic.prompt: (Read list and check all that apply, then skip to question #49)

arrayPrompts.prompt: did not want to be on a medication (desire for abstinence)
Vivitrol has too many side effects
lack of personal identification/documents (e.g., driver’s license, social security card)
didn't have a way to get there/transportation problems
fear of being treated rudely or unkindly
didn't know what doctor to see
family/personal issues (e.g., spouse didn’t want me to get a Vivitrol injection)
preferred to use another type of medication assisted treatment after release such as methadone or buprenorphine (also known as Suboxone and Zubsolv)

eddilogic.title: vvinjat
eddilogic.prompt: <label>What is the name of treatment location (or physician) where you received Vivitrol?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvinjaty
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Why did you select this location?</label>

arrayPrompts.prompt: The only option in my community

eddilogic.title: vvinjprl
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Was your participation in Vivitrol a requirement of your parole?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvinjday
eddilogic.prompt: <label>How long were you on the street before you obtained your first injection of Vivitrol (days)?</label>

eddilogic.title: vvinjnum
eddilogic.prompt: (Note: should be between 1 and 3) (If 3 injections, then skip to question #48)

eddilogic.title: vvinjnoy
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Why have you not received monthly Vivitrol injections? (open ended)</label>

eddilogic.title: vvexprnc
eddilogic.prompt: (Probes: What did you like and dislike about taking Vivitrol? Describe what helped you get Vivitrol in the community? Describe what challenges you faced in getting Vivitrol in the community? Describe your interactions with your doctor who prescribed Vivitrol.)

eddilogic.title: mthdn3mo
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Did you go to a doctor or treatment provider to receive methadone for the treatment of opioid dependence in the past 3 months?</label>

eddilogic.title: buprn3mo
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Did you go to a doctor or a treatment provider to receive buprenorphine (also known as Suboxone and Zubsolv) for the treatment of opioid dependence in the past 3 months?</label>

eddilogic.title: 12stp3mo
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Have you been to AA, NA or other self-help group meetings for an alcohol or drug problem in the past 3 months?</label>

eddilogic.title: 12stprle
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Was your AA/NA attendance a requirement of your parole?</label>

eddilogic.title: 12stdays
eddilogic.prompt: <label>How many days in the past 30 days have you attended AA, NA or other self-help group meetings?</label>

eddilogic.title: 12sthelp
eddilogic.prompt: <label>When you do attend, how often do you find the meetings to be helpful?</label>

eddilogic.title: 12stspnr
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Do you have an AA or NA sponsor?</label>

eddilogic.title: 12sttksp
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Have you had contact with your AA or NA sponsor in the past 30 days?</label>

eddilogic.title: abstnopi
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Based on what you know about yourself and your situation, how good are the chances that you can get off and stay off of opioids? Are they:</label>

eddilogic.title: abstnall
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Based on what you know about yourself and your situation, how good are the chances that you can get off and stay off of all drugs/alcohol? Are they:</label>

eddilogic.title: abstnfac
eddilogic.prompt: (Probe: How would you describe the people who are successful at staying off drugs and alcohol after treatment?)

eddilogic.title: odpreved
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Has anyone ever given you information on how to prevent an overdose?</label>

eddilogic.title: odhelped
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Has anyone ever given you information on how to help someone who has overdosed?</label>

eddilogic.title: odedprov
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Who gave you information on overdoses? (Check all that apply)</label>

eddilogic.title: nlxcnty
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Naloxone is a drug used to treat a narcotic overdose in an emergency. Is naloxone (Narcan, Evzio) available for the treatment of opioid overdose in your county?</label>

arrayPrompts.prompt: I have never heard of Naloxone (Narcan®, Evzio®)

eddilogic.title: nlxkitu
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Do you have a naloxone kit (Narcan, Evzio)?</label>

eddilogic.title: nlxkitfm
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Do any of your family members have a naloxone kit (Narcan, Evzio)?</label>

eddilogic.title: nlxkitfd
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Do any your friends have a naloxone kit (Narcan, Evzio)?</label>

eddilogic.title: Alcohol/Drug Use Status 1
eddilogic.prompt: Now I am going to ask you some questions about your substance use in the past 3 months. I want to remind you that anything you say is confidential.
eddilogic.content: Note: Even if a participant reports no use of illegal drugs in the past 3 months ask about each specific drug. Say something like “I know you indicated that you have not used illegal drugs in the past three months but I still need to read through the list.” Also, the unprescribed use of prescription medication or misuse of prescribed medication (e.g., taking more than prescribed) should be counted as the use of illegal drugs.

eddilogic.prompt: During the past 3 months, how many days did you use....?

eddilogic.title: HealthStatusBoilerplate2
eddilogic.prompt: Next, I’m going to ask you some questions about your knowledge of the Hepatitis C Virus, and it is okay to just take your best guess at the answer. Also, I’m going to ask about your experiences with getting tested for Hepatitis C virus and the human immunodeficiency virus (or HIV, the virus that causes AIDS).

eddilogic.title: hcvqinjt
eddilogic.prompt: <label>The easiest way to get hepatitis C is through sharing equipment to inject drugs</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvqnsym
eddilogic.prompt: <label>The majority of people with chronic hepatitis C do not have any symptoms</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvqwhod
eddilogic.prompt: <label>What can hepatitis C do?</label>

arrayPrompts.prompt: 1 and 2 only (infects cells in the liver and causes inflammation of the liver)

eddilogic.title: hcvqchrn
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Everybody with a positive hepatitis C antibody test has chronic hepatitis C disease (infection).</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvqrxtx
eddilogic.prompt: <label>There is a medication to treat hepatitis C.</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvqvax
eddilogic.prompt: <label>There is a vaccine for hepatitis C.</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvqclr
eddilogic.prompt: <label>People who clear the hepatitis C virus, either spontaneously or after medical treatment, can be infected again.</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvqrisj
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Which statement best describes your chance of getting HCV?</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvinfo
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Has anyone ever given you information on the hepatitis c virus?</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvinwho
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Who gave you that information? (Check all that apply)</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvtest
eddilogic.prompt: <label>Have you ever been tested for the hepatitis C virus?</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvdx
eddilogic.prompt: <label>16. Have you ever been told by a doctor or nurse that you had chronic hepatitis C?</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvdxyr
eddilogic.prompt: <label>17. In what year were you first told you were infected with hepatitis C?</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvdxwho
eddilogic.prompt: <label>18. After testing positive for hepatitis C did you tell: (check all that apply)</label>

arrayPrompts.prompt: drug use partners (people you inject with)
past injection drug use partners (people you inject with)

eddilogic.title: hcvtestat
eddilogic.prompt: <label>19. Where were you tested?</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvtx
eddilogic.prompt: <label>20. Did you seek treatment for hepatitis C?</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvtxat
eddilogic.prompt: <label>21. Where did you go for treatment?</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvtxtyp
eddilogic.prompt: <label>22. What type of treatment were you given?</label>

arrayPrompts.prompt: Interferon or Pegylated Interferon-alpha (e.g. Pegasys, PegIntron, Sylatron, Roferon, Intron, Infergen)
Ribavirin (e.g., Virazole, Rebetol, Copequs, Ribasphere, RibaPak, RivaTab)

eddilogic.title: hcvtxtyp
eddilogic.prompt: <label>23. Did you complete the treatment as prescribed by your doctor?</label>

eddilogic.title: hcvtxnoy
eddilogic.prompt: <label>24. What are the reasons you were not given or refused treatment? ( Check all that apply).</label>

arrayPrompts.prompt: My doctor said I don’t need treatment at this time.
My doctor said I had other health conditions that would interfere with the medicine.
My doctor said he/she would not prescribe it to me if I was still using drugs.
I don't think that hepatitis C is bad enough that I need to take the medicine.
My insurance doesn’t cover the treatment.
I do not have time for all of the doctor visits.
I do not have transportation to and from the doctor.
I am afraid people would find out I have hepatitis C.
I am concerned about the side effects.

eddilogic.title: SocialNetworkInventoryBoilerplate
eddilogic.prompt: Social Network Inventory
eddilogic.content:
In this section I would like to get an idea of the people who are a part of your life in a number of different ways. I will be reading descriptions of ways that people may play roles in your life, or be important to you. These people might be friends, people you use drugs with, family members, sex partners, health care professionals, or other people you might know.

Please try to think about as many people as possible as I ask these questions.

While we understand the importance and influence of people in your life that are deceased or the role of God, this section of the interview will only collect the names of people who are alive.

Please also remember that all the information you tell us today will be kept strictly confidential.

eddilogic.title: gen20
eddilogic.prompt:
Name 20 people you know and have communicated with in the past 3 months since your release from prison. Please provide their first name and last initial.

Participants can name up to 20 individuals, only first name and the first letter of the last name are recorded)

eddilogic.title: gen20add
eddilogic.prompt:
Is there anyone else you can think of?

(If they don’t name up to 20 people)

eddilogic.title: SSpick
eddilogic.prompt:
Of the people you have named, who have you been able to count on for social support in the past 3 months since your release from prison? When I say social support, I mean things like:

- someone who you can talk to about personal or private matters

- someone who would give up their time and energy to help you

- someone who would lend you $25, someone who you could trust to go get a check cashed for you or to guy groceries

- someone you might eat meals with on a regular basis

- someone who you have fun with

- someone who you could ask for advice or help about health problems

- someone who would give you a place to stay if you needed it

eddilogic.title: SSadd
eddilogic.prompt: Is there anyone else you can think of that you can count on for social support since your release that wasn’t named? If so, please provide their first name and initial.

eddilogic.title: drugpick
eddilogic.prompt: Of all of the people you have named, who have you used drugs with in the past 3 months since your release from prison?

eddilogic.title: drugadd
eddilogic.prompt: Is there anyone else you can think of that you that you have used drugs with since your release that wasn’t named? If so, please provide their first name and initial.

eddilogic.title: AlterCharacteristicboil
eddilogic.prompt: Now, I would like to get some information about the people you have just listed. Here is a list of their names.
